author: Michael Larabel
description: Intel's Linux graphics driver engineers continue working on enabling support for the Xe3 integrated graphics premiering with next-gen Core Ultra "Panther Lake" SoCs. Today a number of additional PCI device IDs have been merged to the Mesa 25.2 code to reflect the growing family...
title: More Intel Panther Lake Graphics Device IDs Added To Open-Source Linux Driver

author: Michael Larabel
description: Kexec HandOver "KHO" was merged for the in-development Linux 6.16 kernel as part of all the memory management "MM" changes. Kexec HandOver is providing the basis for some nifty low-level features moving forward...
title: Kexec HandOver "KHO" Merged For Linux 6.16

author: Michael Larabel
description: Researchers from the Technical University of Munich (TUM) have announced TPDE as a fast and adaptable compiler back-end framework. The code is now open-source and they are talking up some very wild compile time improvements... Compiling code for x86_64 and AArch64 with TPDE can be ten to twenty times faster than using the LLVM Clang compiler...
title: Open-Source TPDE Can Compile Code 10-20x Faster Than LLVM

author: Michael Larabel
description: A very convenient addition to Linux 6.16 for system administrators is reporting to user-space via sysfs counters for the number of hard and soft lock-ups as well as RCU stalls...
title: Linux 6.16 Will Now Conveniently Report Hard/Soft Lockups & RCU Stall Counts

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those running an Network File System "NFS" server, the upcoming Linux 6.16 kernel will allow optionally enabling a larger payload size that may yield better performance. Eventually the default payload size may be increased if all goes well from user feedback and testing...
title: NFS Server Supporting Larger I/O Block Size With Linux 6.16

author: Michael Larabel
description: This week on 5 June marks 21 years since I started Phoronix.com for providing Linux hardware reviews and open-source news. In marking the 21st birthday of Phoronix is a special Phoronix Premium offering if you wish to show your support and hopefully provide for a successful year...
title: Phoronix Turns 21 This Week - Show Your Support For Linux Hardware Reviews

author: Michael Larabel
description: Posted for the AMDGPU Linux kernel driver in early 2024 was the initial Video Core Next 5.0 IP enablement that was part of their bring-up for the Radeon RX 9000 "RDNA4" graphics processors. It's taken until now though for enabling the VCN5 video encode/decode support within the user-space code for the RADV driver with Mesa 25.2...
title: Mesa 25.2 Lands RADV VCN5 Video Encode/Decode Support For RDNA4 GPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: While Intel Trust Domain Extensions (TDX) has been around since Sapphire Rapids with select SKUs and with widespread availability since Emerald Rapids in late 2023, only now with the Linux 6.16 kernel debuting in H2'2025 is there going to be mainline kernel support for TDX on the host-side with the Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM)...
title: Intel TDX Host Support Merged For KVM With Linux 6.16

author: Michael Larabel
description: A new version of the Genode open-source operating system framework was released last week that powers its Sculpt OS general purpose OS and over the years has proven to be an interesting technical grounds for those interested in OS concepts...
title: Genode OS Improves Intel GPU Driver, Sandboxing Enhancements
